Excuse me, but I have a bug report about ships dropping out of stable orbits. I've had to move all my ships into 100Km orbits to prevent the instability from making them fall into the atmosphere. I believe it has something to do with the loading of the game, as it seems to only happen when I start up KSP. This often leads to periapsis in the atmosphere or an apoapsis higher than the <abbr title="Sphere of Influence"><abbr title="Sphere of Influence"><abbr title="Sphere of Influence"><abbr title="Sphere of Influence"><abbr title="Sphere of Influence">SOI</abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr></abbr>. This seems to be a bug unique to Kerbin orbits, as none of my other ships have been destabilised. I think this has something to do with re-parenting Kerbin, and seems to be unique to the 2.0 version of Hew Horizons.I'll try to recreate this without NH and see if I still have the bug

EDIT: Tested without NH. Could not reproduce the bug

EDIT2: It seems that for a few seconds, the ships are orbiting Sonnah not Kerbin. When the game is loaded for the first time, their orbital references say 36, which is the ID for Sonnah. When the game is auto saved, it turns back into 1, Kerbin ID. But this indicates that Kerbin <abbr title="Sphere of Influence"><abbr title="Sphere of Influence">SOI</abbr></abbr> could not be loaded at the start of the game, or Sonnah has a higher loading priority 

EDIT3: This seems to be a Kopernicus bug not a New Horizons bug. And I found that if I load a save that I don't mind what happens too, exit and go to the save that I want to go to, the ships won't be deorbited. This is probably a bug from the new Kopernicus version not New Horizons 2.0, so don't worry, and keep up the good work ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")

This seems unique to ships in Kerbin <abbr title="Sphere of Influence"><abbr title="Sphere of Influence">SOI</abbr></abbr>, even if they are in escape trajectories. There is a work around though: Make a save. Copy and paste the persistent file from the save folder you normally play and paste it in the new save, replacing the persistent in the new save. Play this save folder as soon as you open KSP. The orbits will be messed up, but you have 2 saves so it doesn't matter. You must go to the tracking station when you open the copy save. Then exit and play your regular save as normal. The bug only affects the first save you open, and only affects it once, per every game launch. It's an easy but annoying workaround.

Brace for next update:

Go to C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common (or wherever you have it) and just make copy/rename of KSP directory to protect it from Steam.

Example of KSP protected from updates:

![gFaipF6.png](http://i.imgur.com/gFaipF6.png)

"Kerbal Space Program" is where Steam puts KSP. After update I just add version to name, make shortcut on desktop, and never worry about updates breaking my modded save. Only "negative" side effect I can think of is Steam not counting play time. Meh.

Alternatively, if you do not want to make copies, you can disable automatic update for KSP:

![uaPuHjd.png](http://i.imgur.com/uaPuHjd.png)

If you switch to "Only update this game when I launch it" it will ask before you open game, and if I am not mistaken, you will have option to ignore update.
Questionb guys, do any of you have a way to resize Kerbin and all the stock objects to life sized sizes?

I'm playing KSP 1.1.3 x64 with NH 2.0.0 and Kopernicus 1.1.2.  Kopernicus is for KSP 1.1.3 and NH is for 1.1.2 (I know, confusing version numbers for Kopernicus).  NH is the only Kopernicus-related thing I have in this game.

My problem is that my stuff in orbit around Kerbin won't hold still.  Everything's <abbr title="Periapsis">Pe</abbr> decreases and its <abbr title="Apoapsis">Ap</abbr> increases.  The lower the orbit, the faster this happens and the bigger the changes.  In fact, it's so bad that orbits below about 300km are essentially useless.  This happens by itself when the ships are on rails, not on physics load.  IOW, I put something in oribt, go do something else, and when I look at it again days later in the tracking center, the orbit has changed.  This happens whether the ship got to the original orbit via rocketry or HyperEdit--makes no difference.

So questions:  Is this a known bug?  Is this happening for anybody else?  Is this a result of using an obsolete version of NH?  Thanks.

Here are some examples:

[![NH Decay 1](https://farm8.staticflickr.com/7438/28059147755_2021310fde_z.jpg)](https://flic.kr/p/JKut4z)

The station in question was originally in an 80 x 80 orbit.  In a few hours, this had become 72 x 90 so I moved it up to 100 x 100.  And then the above happened.

So then I moved the station up to 150 x 150 orbit.  That didn't last long, either.

[![NH Decay 2](https://farm8.staticflickr.com/7104/27445232573_815664631b_b.jpg)](https://flic.kr/p/HPeZt4)

What you're seeing looks a lot like the old Mun orbit bug, only around Kerbin. Which IMHO makes it a bigger practical issue because you can just ignore the Mun but you can't ignore Kerbin.

From what I've read the issue at Kerbin is new to KSP 1.1.3 and Kopernicus 1.1 and later. Kopernicus has a hard version lock, so it's not straightforward to even attempt using an older Kopernicus on the latest KSP or vice versa, something I might otherwise do to try and isolate the issue.
